title: Kenya: Westgate Reopens Two Years After Terror Attack, Kidero Assures Nairobi Residents of Security
text:
Kenya: Westgate Mall Officially Reopens Two Years After Terror Attack 
He said Westgate's opening is an indicator of Nairobi's position as an attractive place to live, work and invest. 
"Security has not only been stepped up in all malls in the city but Nairobi in general. The introduction of Neighbourhood Associations will ensure that every ward has a registry of its inhabitants and any suspicious characters will be weeded out. We are also increasing the number of street lights from 26,000 to 82,000 to continue in the promotion of security in the City," he added. 
Police Inspector General Joseph Boinett who was also at the reopening said via twitter: From the waste, the rubble and the ruins, we have rebuilt Westgate Shopping Mall Shopping Mall. They cannot stop us. No. Never," "Come and be part of the symbol of resilience and courage that Kenya is. Mall looks magnificent. Our new symbol of courage and resilience; strength and fortitude," the IG added. A cleaner on the second floor of the shopping mall who had worked at the mall on the day of the attack, said he received a wage increase after returning. 
He said this was because a lot of his colleagues who worked at the mall did not want to return to the mall following the attack. Reuters had reported on Wednesday that a private Israeli security firm, I.R.G has taken over security at the ma.. It has about 25 specialist staff and will use about 55 guards from security firm G4S, one I.R.G employee told Reuters inside Westgate. New security features will include explosive detectors, luggage X-rays, scanners to check underneath cars, bollards to prevent car bombs, and bullet-proof guard towers. 
"This will be the safest mall in the world," said Cohen, an I.R.G. employee who did not wish to give his full name. Kidero told Reuters that the attack was one was "one of the saddest days in Kenyan history" but touted the re-opening of the mall as a triumph of national resilience in the face of militant attacks.
